text: urllib2 will do what you want and it's pretty simple to use.

code:
import urllib
import urllib2

params = {'param1': 'value1'}

req = urllib2.Request("http://someurl", urllib.urlencode(params))
res = urllib2.urlopen(req)

data = res.read()

text: It's also nice because it's easy to modify the above code to do all sorts of other things like POST requests, Basic Authentication, etc.
A simple wget called from a shell script might suffice.
If you need your script to actually function as a user of the site (clicking links, etc.
) then you're probably looking for the python mechanize library.
What are you trying to do?
If you're just trying to fetch a web page, cURL is a pre-existing (and very common) tool that does exactly that.
You might want to simply use httplib from the standard library.
you can find the official reference here: http://docs.python.org/library/httplib.html
